reasoning: Invasive lobular carcinoma (ILC) is a specific histological subtype comprising approximately 10-15% of all breast cancers. Using GLOBOCAN 2005 global breast cancer incidence of ~37 per 100k (both sexes), and estimated ILC proportion of 14%, this yields ~5.2 per 100k incidence for lobular breast cancer globally. Confidence reflects good source data for total breast cancer but some uncertainty in ILC subtype proportion across populations.
source: Derived from Parkin DM et al. (2005). Global cancer statistics, 2002. CA Cancer J Clin. 55(2):74-108; ILC subtype proportion from histopathological literature
